com.centurylink.mdw.adapter

Interface PoolableAdapter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnectionPoolAdapter, DocumentWebServiceAdapter, HttpServiceAdapter, MdwRpcWebServiceAdapter, MultiRestServiceAdapter, PoolableAdapterBase, PublishEventMessageRest, RestServiceAdapter, SlackNotificationAdapter, SoapWebServiceAdapter, SocketAdapter

    public interface PoolableAdapter
    This class is an interface for defining poolable adapters which can be used as activities as well as by connection pools. A connection pool manages a set of connections, represented by instances of the class PooledConnection, and each connection manages an instance of PoolableAdapter.

      • openConnection

        Object openConnection()
               throws ConnectionException,
                      AdapterException
        Open connection
        Returns:
        An object representing an open connection. It is typical to return the adapter activity instance itself, although any other object (but null) can be returned, which will be parsed in as a parameter to invoke() and closeConnection().
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - retriable connection failure
        AdapterException - non-retriable connection failure

      • closeConnection

        void closeConnection(Object connection)
        Close a connection opened.
        Parameters:
        conneciton - the object returned by openConnection() and is typically the adapter activity instance itself.

      • invoke

        String invoke(Object connection,
              String request,
              int timeout,
              Map<String,String> headers)
       throws AdapterException,
              ConnectionException
        send a message to external system, and if the underlying protocol is synchronous (WebService, EJB, etc), the response is returned. To support auto-retry (may or may not be certified message), the implementation should throws AdapterException when an error is detected and is non-retriable, and throws ConnectionException if hitting a retriable error. When it is used to support certified message, the method should throw exceptions unless a correct acknowledgment is received.
        Parameters:
        conneciton - the object returned by openConnection() and is typically the adapter activity instance itself.
        request -
        timeout - time out in seconds. Ignored if no response is expected.
        headers - protocol request data, e.g. correlation ID
        Returns:
        response if the underlying protocol is synchronous or null otherwise
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - retriable exception
        AdapterException - non-retriable exception

      • doInvoke

        Response doInvoke(Object connection,
                  String request,
                  int timeout,
                  Map<String,String> headers)
           throws AdapterException,
                  ConnectionException
        Throws:
        AdapterException
        ConnectionException

      • ping

        boolean ping(int timeout)
        This method is used for auto-shutdown and restart in a connection pool, so need only to be implemented appropriately if you intend to use auto-restart feature. The method is only used by connection pools, not by activities.
        Parameters:
        timeout - timeout in seconds. The value is obtained from the property PingTimeout in the pool configuration. If PingTimeout is not specified, the value of the property "timeout" is used. If "timeout" is not specified either, then -1 is passed in.
        Returns:
        true if the connection is up, and false if it is still down.
